channel.title: Getting sued by Jagex?
channel.description: What are the chances of getting sued or "warned" by Jagex if I run a 24/7 server with a website that sells premium and accepts donations? I want to run my server forever without having to change the name and the site because of Jagex. My old server (Knight's Realm) was only accepting donations and I got 3 warnings from Jagex, so I decided to make a new server like it but better and change the name. I switched from Knight's Realm to RuneEden.

item.title: Getting sued by Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

#1. No you will not get sued by Jagex, the odds are like 1/99999999999.
#2. Jagex has some of the worst law personal I have seen in years (I know cause my dads a lawyer)
#3. Jagex’s only reason for getting rid of Private Runescape Servers is because they don’t want any competition, its all about the moneynow
#4. Jagex has been trying to “shut down” my server for about 2 years now, im not even scraed of them anymore, when they send me emails now I send funny responses back.
#5. Jagex is not powerful unless you live in there area, they cant tuch the united states lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting sued by Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @daved daved
item.description:
@daved wrote:

the wow thing is really annoying, I think I’m going to track them down and make them suffer. If you click on their site you will be redirected to worldofwaZcraft.com which is a fake login page. It is clever, but could be better

You can answer jagex and ask them to tell you what you’ve done. If everyone that owns a server would fight back I think they won’t even bother to close servers down anymore… They don’t have the power to do anything to you anyway, they are probably just trying to scare you and make you give up.

What I suggest is to reply them back, be gentle, show them respect but trick them at the same time. If you’re smart you are gonna make it, if they are ever going to email you, of course.

Have a good day! If they email you, tell them to pay me a visit.

Read full topic

@Frell wrote:

Put it on the server status and you’re protected by MITB.

Owner Torax:

I know they faked it, I don’t know why though.

item.title: Getting sued by Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Rofl. You got any idea how many emails I’ve received from WoWaccountadmin@blizzard.com?
Looks real doesnt it…

Greetings! This is an automated notification regarding the recent change(s) made to your World of Warcraft account. Your password has recently been modified through the Password Recovery website. *** If you made this password change, please disregard this notification. However, if you did NOT make changes to your password we recommend you Login verify your password: http://www.worldofwarcraft.com If you are unable to successfully verify your password . using the automated system, please contact Billing & Account Services at 1-800-59-BLIZZARD (1-800-592-5499) Mon-Fri, 8am-8pm Pacific Time or at billing@blizzard.com. Account security is solely the responsibility of the account holder. Please be advised that in the event of a compromised account, Blizzard representatives typically must lock the account. In these cases the Account Administration team will require faxed receipt of ID materials before releasing the account for play. Regards, The World of Warcraft Support Team Blizzard Entertainment

Read full topic

jads:

I’m assuming you received these ‘warnings’ by email from “JaGeX”. Have you ever considered trying to track the IP the emails were sent from?

You do know how easy I can send you an email from @jagex.com with a php mailer, do you?

Give me your email and you’ll have about 20 messages from @jagex.com in like a few minutes, lol.

Frugooscape faked being sued.
The hell is a yanillescape?

item.title: Getting sued by Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Owner Torax:

Yes the warnings I received were much like those ones. But he fought it, what are the chances of getting sued if I fight it since he just owns a site and I host a 24/7 server?

You need to know the laws in your country, and decide if what you are doing is illegal or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting sued by Jagex?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

MITB was very strong in his replies as you can see. Since this site is not hosting anything, only providing information, Jagex cant do a thing.
But a public server, that’s also commercial… They will try to take you down if they get the chance.

By means of copyright claims towards your VPS host, and your website’s host too. Think of it as scare tactics…

Read full topic
